availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Baltimore, Maryland physician. New Hampshire native. Son of Nathan Smith. Married to Julietta O. Penniman Smith in Colchester, Vermont on July 26, 1821. Father of Adelia Smith, Allen P. Smith, and Walter P. Smith. Graduated from Yale College with a degree in medicine in 1820. Physician in Baltimore, Maryland in 1860. Chief of Surgery at the University of Maryland from 1840-1870. Employed Rose Sloan and Ann Collins as dairy maids in Baltimore in 1860. Employed Anna Jones and Louisa Walker as servants in Baltimore in 1860. Employed Ellen Dorsey and William Harris as laborers in Baltimore in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Maryland, Baltimore County, District 1, p. 879.
Vermont, Vital Records, 1720-19081870 and prior, p. 1235 of 3887 of microfilm.
Obituary Record of Graduates of Yale Collegehttp://mssa.library.yale.edu/obituaryrecord/18591924/1877-78.pdf (viewed on July 8, 2020) pp. 286-287.
Find A Grave, "Nathan Ryno Smith (May 28, 1797-Jul 3, 1877)," Memorial #139993827, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/139993827 (accessed July 8, 2020).
